Gatara/Riekan/Jayde::

At about that moment, the three Rogues let loose their combined 
firepower against the unsuspecting Burrock.  Gatara fires first, her 
fingers squeezing down on both her rifle's triggers, launching a 
barrage of magnum rounds and a grenade.  This acts as a signal for 
the other two: Riekan launches an explosive harpoon, and Jayde fires 
several bursts from her ionic blaster.  (Much like the weapon that 
G1's Blast Off uses in robot mode, it doesn't physically damage its 
target, instead disrupting the electrical impulses that control both 
organic and mechanoid nervous systems, causing spasms or possibly 
shorting a bot out altogether.)

Firing their weapons makes the Rogues temporarily visible, but they 
quicky scatter and recloak, seeking to assess the damage they caused.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Tyrael had not spotted Talon yet, and he started to not care about 
> him. Seeing Waspinator go down and Perceptor transform made him 
smile 
> and laugh. Quickstrike was the next one standing. He sent four 
> luminous blasts at the weird looking bot.
> 
> Burrock took grasp of Waspinator's stasis locked form and threw it 
at 
> Perceptor.
> 
> Burrock: Maybe that'll stop you! Whatever happens, you preds can 
not 
> match us! Stay put so we can rip your sparks off!
